reviews.review: absolutely loved it so did t bgg e grandkids

Frozen 2 was overall entertaining. The characters were good, although they were going through same struggles of "finding self" and "not getting shut out", so there was some staleness there. Olaf has some really funny scenes that causes actual audible laughter. And the 80's music video scene with Kristoff was quite sarcastically intelligent, in my opinion. I felt there were some holes in the overall storyline, as well as playing out the obvious that left me wishing for more. I would say it was a goodnight out with the family, but it lacked the pioneering entertainment value that the first Frozen had.
The Cga was fabulous. The children loved it! Songs were trite. Story was predictable. $$$ maker.

Definitely not as light as the first one with some content that might go over little kids heads. On a whole I found the movie to be dark the ending didn’t leave you with a light step but left you wondering if you saw a child’s animation or not. Overall the animation was beautiful the colors rich and storyline engaging. There was a lot of music which I don’t mind if it helps move the story along which it really didn’t they were more just songs tailored to each character. I did like that Disney tried to have the story mature with the aging original audience and attempted to put in some great mental health practices. I wish that they would have clued us into that during some of the trailers. Overs a good rewatch able movie
It was an example of the BEST of Disney. It wasnt an add on, but a stand alone movie that didnt need another movie to make sense.
Just wonderful...Disney at it's best. Liked it better than Frozen I.
Great movie. Great soundtrack. A little scary for young children. My oldest cried, she’s 8. Overall on par if not better than the first movie
Its magical and I love it , takes your mind out of the real life chaos .
Olaf was genuinely hilarious in this. The soundtrack is amazing, the visuals are spectacular, and the message of never giving up is brilliantly told for kids.
An unnecessary sequel but can't help but be amazed by the technical mastery on show and a few catchy numbers.
